column1: #Text=Observing the constellations makes for a great hobby that can even lead to a career as an astronomer or to another space-related career .
#Text=This article provides some of the basics for finding constellations .
#Text=Be aware that there are sky charts or maps that indicate the location of each constellation .
#Text=For the purposes of map-making , the celestial sphere is divided into six sections consisting of the northern and southern polar regions and four equatorial areas .
#Text=These refer to the locations where you can view the sky section .
#Text=If you 're keen on seeing a certain constellation but you do n't live where you can see it , you 'll need to plan a grand expedition !
#Text=( For example , stars that can be seen in the far northern latitudes cannot be seen in the far southern latitudes , and vice versa , because they do not rise above the horizon . )
#Text=Some constellations , such as Orion , can be seen across most of the inhabited world .
#Text=Sky maps look flat to us but that is so that they can fit inside a flat book .
#Text=In reality , the sky is like a dome .
#Text=Note that there are 88 officially recognized constellations .
#Text=Most amateur astronomers tend to look for those constellations that have notable features or recognizable star patterns .
#Text=What you will be able to see when looking in a particular constellation not only depends on your geographic location but also on your equipment and local light pollution .
#Text=Stars with a magnitude 6.5 and greater can usually be seen with the naked eye or with standard binoculars .
#Text=You can also look for star clusters , nebulae , differently colored stars and galaxies .
#Text=Many constellations have been known for thousands of years .
#Text=In the time of ancient Greece , 48 constellations were noted by Ptolemy , a Greek astronomer .
#Text=From here , look for the following constellations :
#Text=This is also known as the Pole Star or the North Star .
#Text=Owing to the fact that Earth 's axis is aligned to a point near this star , it appears to us that this star stays in the same spot .
#Text=This has been useful for navigators throughout history .

#Text=In Boötes , you 'll find Arcturus , which has a red coloring and is very bright .
#Text=In the Virgo constellation , you 'll find Spica , which has a blue color .
#Text=Leo is probably the most well known constellation .
#Text=View the constellations for this sky chart during December , January and February .
#Text=Look for the following constellations from this chart :
#Text=This part of the night sky contains a lot of the bright stars , making it a good place to look , especially if you 're just learning to spot the constellations .
#Text=In particular , look for the Orion constellation , which contains a line of three very bright stars that form " Orion 's belt " .
#Text=Other bright stars include Aldebaran in the Taurus constellation and the Pleiades ( the Seven Sisters ) , known as the M45 star cluster .
#Text=The Canis Major constellation has Sirius ( the Dog Star ) , which is the brightest star in our night sky .
#Text=How to Tell the Difference Between Planets and Stars
#Text=Some of the constellations form the Zodiac .
